title: Introduction to FME Desktop 2020 (and ArcGIS Data Interoperability)

New to FME Workbench? This course introduces the essential components and capabilities of FME through hands-on problem-solving exercises. Learn how to work with spreadsheet and Google maps data, all without any coding. No prior FME or GIS experience is required.

ArcGIS Data Interoperability is an extension for Pro and Enterprise that connects to hundreds of apps and data formats using Safe Software's FME technology, the world's most spatially aware  extract, transform, and load (ETL) geoprocessing framework.

title: Examine the distribution of Starbucks in ArcGIS Online
short_title: ArcGIS Online can be used to examine the number and distribution of businesses such as Starbucks
description:
Use this map to learn about the spatial pattern of business and also to become familiar with ArcGIS Online, a cloud-based GIS.  Change the symbology, make a heat map, and examine the number and pattern of Starbucks in New York City, other cities, and your own community.  Note that different business types have different population thresholds.  How
does the type of product influence where it expands globally?  How does the location of the headquarters of a chain influence where, how, and the rate at which it expands?  This map should be used for education purposes and not the actual current location of Starbucks.
